q: been burned for three straight games of at least 40 points by the 76ers All-Star. "Honestly, they play me one-on-one, straight up," Allen Iverson said of a Bucks' defense he penetrated at will. Except in the last quarter. Elgin Baylor guess they felt like they had to do something. By then, it was too late. Allen Iverson reached 40 points against the Bucks for the sixth time in his career, his most against any opponent. He had 40 and 54 points in his previous two games

As for honoring a convicted felon, Dwaine Caraway said, "I care deeply about animals" and "am deeply sorry to offend anyone who loves animals." He acknowledged Michael Vick 's past but noted that since making some bad choices, Michael Vick has devoted time to speaking to children about staying in school staying away from drugs, making positive choices about picking friends and the importance of education. That was the focus of the event. Mayor Tom Leppert said he has asked the city manager to "propose guidelines to prevent this situation in the future. so, but it turns out a State Department cable exists in which Saddam Hussein thanked Donald Rumsfeld for the message. The letter must have come from the State Department itself, Donald Rumsfeld says. How could anyone believe that you couldn't remember if you delivered a letter from Ronald Reagan to Saddam Hussein ? he says. "That's the kind of thing that persuaded me to take my time and look at the documents, since I had so many of them."

release for Martin Luther King Day doesn't have much to do with civil rights, strictly speaking. It addresses the shooting of Rep. Gabrielle Giffords of Arizona and the rhetorical and budgetary attacks on public employees of recent months. ALBANY, NY( 01/14/2011)- The recent horrific events in Tuscon have saddened us all. However, from every tragedy lessons can be learned and the attention given by many to the contribution of violent rhetoric as cause for the shootings may be just the opening to bring civility back to our public discourse. I am further bolstered by the genuine joy expressed by U.S. Senator Kirsten Gillibrand in her account of the awakening of her friend and colleague Congresswoman Gabrielle Giffords during a visit to the shooting victim's hospital room.

now was the right moment to make some changes to the way we are structured." According to Eric Schmidt , the three had been "equally" involved in making decisions over the past decade. This triumvirate approach has real benefits in terms of shared wisdom, and we will continue to discuss the big decisions among the three of us. "But we have also agreed to clarify our individual roles so there's clear responsibility and accountability at the top of the company.[ And] Larry, in my clear opinion, is ready to lead...[ Yes], day-to-day adult supervision is no longer needed. " Bill Stephan , a friend of Mike Pence 's since they attended the Indiana University School of Law-Indianapolis together, said Mike Pence was always clear on what he stood for and what he was passionate about. I just remember Mike Pence as someone who, even then, wore his heart on his sleeve, Bill Stephan said. Mike Pence said he embraced the Republican Party while attending law school, largely because he heard in Ronald Reagan "the manifestation of the kind of traditional Michael Feinstein ideals that I was raised to believe in
